description: Sogeking is the masked superhero alter ego of Usopp, created to allow him to help the Straw Hats rescue Robin while maintaining his pride after leaving the crew. He wears a gold sun-like mask and red cape, claiming to be from Sniper Island.

keyMoments.title: Sogeking's Debut
keyMoments.description: Sogeking makes his dramatic first appearance on the Puffing Tom sea train, shooting a Marine to save Sanji and Franky. He introduces himself as the sniper from Sniper Island and performs his iconic theme song.
keyMoments.significance: This marks the beginning of one of One Piece's most beloved running gags, as Usopp creates an alter ego to help his friends while maintaining his pride.

relationships.description: Sogeking is Usopp's masked hero persona, though Luffy and Chopper don't recognize this.
Sogeking teams up with Sanji on the Puffing Tom to rescue Robin.
Sogeking teams up with Franky on the Puffing Tom to rescue Robin.

description: Wanze is a CP7 agent and chef who specializes in Ramen Kenpo, a bizarre martial art where he creates ramen by eating flour and kneading dough in his mouth, then extracting noodles through his nose to form weapons.

keyMoments.title: Wanze's Debut
keyMoments.description: Wanze appears skating across the kitchen car of the Puffing Tom with his food trolley, immediately encountering Sanji and Franky as they infiltrate the Sea Train.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the most unique and comedic fighting styles in One Piece, setting up his future battle with Sanji.

relationships.description: Wanze opposes Sanji on the Sea Train as a CP7 agent.

status: Unknown (thrown into ocean during Aqua Laguna)
description: Nero is a former CP9 agent who mastered four of the six Rokushiki techniques. He was the newest member of CP9 but was later expelled by Rob Lucci for inadequate training and emotional weakness.

keyMoments.title: Nero's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Nero appears on the Puffing Tom as a CP9 agent escorting Nico Robin to Enies Lobby, demonstrating his mastery of Rokushiki techniques.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a new CP9 member who will later prove to be insufficiently trained, leading to his expulsion from the organization.

relationships.description: Nero helps escort Robin to Enies Lobby as a prisoner.
Nero will fight Franky on the Sea Train.

reveals.description: Revealed to know four of the six Rokushiki techniques

description: T Bone is one of the most genuinely honorable Marine officers in One Piece, known for his chivalrous behavior, compassion for his subordinates, and absolute abhorrence of needless violence. Despite his skull-like face, he is kind-hearted.

keyMoments.title: T Bone Shows Compassion
keyMoments.description: T Bone notices a Marine with an injured arm from a bug bite and tears a piece from his own cape to bandage the wound, demonstrating his caring nature.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes T Bone as an exceptionally honorable Marine who genuinely cares for his subordinates, setting him apart from typical Marine antagonists.

relationships.description: T Bone cares deeply for his Marine subordinates and treats them with compassion.

keyMoments.title: Usopp Refuses to Help as Himself
keyMoments.description: When Franky asks Usopp to help rescue Robin, Usopp refuses, stating he is no longer a member of the Straw Hat Pirates. However, he soon creates the Sogeking persona to help anyway.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Usopp's internal struggle between his pride and his desire to help his friends, leading to the creation of his Sogeking alter ego.

keyMoments.title: Transformation into Sogeking
keyMoments.description: Usopp transforms into Sogeking by putting on a gold sun-like mask and red cape, creating a superhero persona that allows him to help while maintaining his pride.
keyMoments.significance: This transformation represents Usopp's growth in finding creative solutions to his internal conflicts and shows his determination to do the right thing despite his pride.

relationships.description: Sogeking is Usopp's masked superhero persona created to help the crew while maintaining his pride.

reveals.description: Usopp creates the Sogeking persona to reconcile his pride with his desire to help his friends

keyMoments.title: Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon
keyMoments.description: Luffy coordinates with Zoro to perform their first major combination attack, breaking through the Aqua Laguna. He simplifies the math from 216 to 300 because it's easier to say.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's ability to work in perfect sync with Zoro and showcases their combined power. This becomes one of the most iconic combination attacks in the series.

abilities: Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon (combination attack with Zoro)

keyMoments.title: Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon
keyMoments.description: Zoro coordinates with Luffy to perform their first major combination attack, using his Hyakuhachi Pound Ho technique combined with Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Cannon to break through the Aqua Laguna.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's perfect synchronization with Luffy and his willingness to work as part of a team despite his lone wolf tendencies.

abilities: Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon (combination attack with Luffy)

keyMoments.title: Sanji Contacts the Crew
keyMoments.description: Sanji successfully makes contact with the main group on the Rocketman and updates them on the situation aboard the Puffing Tom.
keyMoments.significance: Coordinates the two groups' efforts to rescue Robin and keeps everyone informed of mission progress.

keyMoments.title: Encountering Wanze
keyMoments.description: Sanji and Franky encounter Wanze, the CP7 chef, in the kitchen car of the Puffing Tom.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Sanji's upcoming battle with Wanze and his bizarre Ramen Kenpo fighting style.

keyMoments.title: Franky Asks Usopp for Help
keyMoments.description: Franky tells Usopp to help rescue Robin, but Usopp initially refuses. This leads to Usopp creating the Sogeking persona.
keyMoments.significance: Franky's request inadvertently triggers Usopp's transformation into Sogeking, showing Franky's practical approach to the mission.
